quote: Hey, what are you looking at?

quote: If you're looking for a way out,    forget it --

scene: 1    INT. PROCESSING CENTER - NIGHT #3 - MOMENTS LATER

quote: I'm going to let you think about    that for a while... Now sit down,    all of you, over there.

quote: We need them alive.  They're the    only thing we have to bargain with.

scene: 1    INT. PROCESSING CENTER - NIGHT #3 - MOMENTS LATER

quote: We'd better get these blinds    closed.

quote: Too bad... I kind of like watching    this place burn.

quote: Smart boy.  Now get back there.

quote: National Guard units are mobilizing    now and should reach Sanctuary    District "A" within the hour.     Governor Chen has issued a statement    saying the uprising will be quelled    and the Sanctuary District secured.     It's still not clear how this riot    began, though rumors of mounting    tensions have been filtering out of    the district for weeks.

This is great.  We're on every    channel.  I bet they're even watching    this in China.    (reacting to the     reports)   What do they sound so surprised for?     You treat people like animals, you    get bit.
Let me through.
Hey, who said you could come in    here?
It's okay.  Let him in.
You know this gimmie?
He's a friend.
You... join your friends.
I'm glad to see you're all right...
So much for our peaceful    demonstration...
I know this isn't what we talked    about... but it's what happened --    and now we have to deal with it.
How?  It's a madhouse out there...    and this building is crawling with    ghosts.
I know.  That's the first thing we    have to fix.  I want you to go out    and find some gimmies, people you    know, people who can be trusted to    help guard the hostages.
If we leave it to the ghosts, there's    no telling what could happen.
I think I know just the people you're    looking for.
Good.       We're going to need them.
Hey, Bell.  You're really missing    something here.

... Sanctuary Residents have looted    the district's food distribution    centers, and there are reports of at    least a dozen fires.  Many of the    district employees fleeing the riot    have been reported injured and several    have yet to be accounted for.  There's    been no official count of injuries    among Sanctuary residents, however    satellite pictures show a number of    possible casualties.
This is terrible.
I've got to get down there.
What are you talking about?
My friends are in there.
I know.       But there's nothing you can do for    them.
I have to try.
It's too dangerous, Jadzia.  You    could get hurt.
Maybe.  But at least I'll have done    something.  I just can't sit here,    watching that place burn, knowing my    friends are inside.
Listen... I have some friends in the    police department.  When things settle    down a little bit, I'll talk to them    about--
I can't wait that long.  By the time    things settle down, my friends could    be hurt... or even killed.  They    don't belong in there.  None of those    people do.
Jadzia, wait.
I'll come with you.    (turns off the     Interface)   I guess I'm getting tired of just    watching, too.

First Officer's Log, supplemental.     Somehow Sisko, Dax, and Bashir have    altered Earth's history.  We have no    choice but to send an away team into    the past, to try to find them, and to   correct the changes to the timeline.     The only problem is, we're not exactly    sure where to look... or when.

According to our computer simulations,    the degree of temporal displacement    is directly proportional to the number    of chroniton particles interacting    with the transporter beam.     Unfortunately, there's no way to    know the exact concentration of    particles at the time of the accident,    but I've narrowed it down to ten    possibilities, each one corresponding    to a different time frame.  One of    them has to be right.       We'll just have to hope we find the    right one before we run out of    chroniton particles.
I feel ridiculous.
Well, it does effectively disguise    your Bajoran heritage.
If anyone asks, just say you broke    your nose.
Better yet, don't say anything.  Let    me do the talking.
That's fine with me.
Good luck.
Energize...
as Kira and O'Brien MATERIALIZE just    inside an alley.  It's late, and no    one's around... O'Brien immediately    takes out his TRICORDER and starts    scanning.
scene: 9    EXT. SAN FRANCISCO STREET ALLEY - PROHIBITION ERA -

quote: If this is where Commander Sisko and    the others materialized, there should    be a residual electrostatic charge.
scene: 9    EXT. SAN FRANCISCO STREET ALLEY - PROHIBITION ERA -

quote: Kira to Sisko.       Kira to Dax.  Kira to Bashir.
scene: 9    EXT. SAN FRANCISCO STREET ALLEY - PROHIBITION ERA -

quote: Judging from that vehicle, I'd say    we were somewhere in the mid-twentieth    century.
scene: 9    EXT. SAN FRANCISCO STREET ALLEY - PROHIBITION ERA -

quote: No one's responding to my hails.
scene: 9    EXT. SAN FRANCISCO STREET ALLEY - PROHIBITION ERA -

quote: I'm not reading any electrostatic    variance... or any distress signals.     They're definitely not here...
scene: 9    EXT. SAN FRANCISCO STREET ALLEY - PROHIBITION ERA -

quote: How long before the transporter re-   engages?
scene: 9    EXT. SAN FRANCISCO STREET ALLEY - PROHIBITION ERA -

quote: About thirty seconds...
scene: 9    EXT. SAN FRANCISCO STREET ALLEY - PROHIBITION ERA -

quote: Evening...
scene: 9    EXT. SAN FRANCISCO STREET ALLEY - PROHIBITION ERA -

quote: I broke my nose.
scene: 9    EXT. SAN FRANCISCO STREET ALLEY - PROHIBITION ERA -

quote: I asked them to help.
And who invited you?
I did.
We needed people we could trust in    here.
What's that supposed to mean?
How many Ghosts do you know who you    can really trust?
(thinks it over for a     beat)   One.  Me.  And that's enough.
No, it isn't.  Not here.  Not now.
Someone's got to guard the building,    watch the exits.  Keep an eye on the    hostages when we need to sleep.
Okay, okay.  You made your point.     Just keep them out of my hair.
The important thing is to decide    what we're going to do with those    hostages.
You don't have to worry about    that.  I've got it all figured    out.
I bet you do.
And just to prove I'm not a bad    guy, I'm going to let you two in    on it.  It's simple.
We trade the hostages for our freedom.     We get amnesty, a handful of credit    chips, and a flight to... anywhere    we want.  Personally, I'm thinking    Tasmania.
Tasmania.
Errol Flynn was born there.       You go where you want; I'll go where    I want.
Yeah, and as soon as we step off the    plane, they lock us up.
Besides, we can't just think about    ourselves.  There're ten thousand    people living in here.
Yeah, well they can find their own    hostages.
No, Gabe is right.  This is an    opportunity.  To make ourselves heard.     To let people on the outside know    what's going on in here.
You want to make demands, I'll give    you some demands.  We tell them if    they want the hostages back, they've    got to close down the Sanctuaries.
That's right.  And reinstate the    Federal Employment Act.

Sounds good to me.  Why don't you    have them throw in some silk shirts    and a penthouse in Singapore while    you're at it?       Jobs.  You guys want jobs?  When are    you going to figure it out?  There    are no jobs.  Not for us, anyway.
They'll find us jobs.  They'll have    to.  After tonight, they won't be    able to ignore us anymore.
All right, we'll do it your way;    see what happens.  I'll log onto    the Interface.  I'll tell them we    want the District closed.  See    what happens.
Not you.       Him.
Funny, I would've nominated you.
What?  Is something wrong with me?     I can be as eloquent as the next    guy.

I'm sure you can.  But they won't be    able to dismiss Webb as easily as    they would you or me.  He's got the    face.  He's got the family.  He's    the guy next door.  And that's what    they need to see.

Here we go.       My name is Michael Webb.  I used to    be a Plant Manager at ChemTech    Industries.  I'm speaking for the    residents of Sanctuary District "A."     We're holding six hostages... we    don't want to hurt them... all we    want is --
What happened?
Someone's cut off our access to the    Interface...
I knew it!  I knew this was a    waste of time.  They don't care.     No one cares about us.
Why should they?  You're all a bunch    of losers.
What did you say?
He didn't say anything.
You heard me.  I called you a loser.     Because that's what you are.  And    this time, you're going to lose big.
Okay, that's enough.
Check your E-mail, buddy.  You're a    loser, too.
If you want to get out of here, you'd    better hope you're wrong.
Quiet down, Vin.  You're only making    things worse.

I just want these guys to know what    they're in for.  I bet the National    Guard's already got this place    surrounded.  And sooner or later,    they're going to roll right in here,    and you people won't even slow them    down.
(perfectly rational, re:     Vin)   I really think we should kill this    guy.
Maybe you'd better talk to the police    first.
Mister Webb, I'm Detective Preston    of the S.F.P.D...
Did you shut off our access to the    Interface?
I'm afraid that's department policy    in these types of situations.  But    it does give us a chance to talk one-   on-one...
All right, let's talk.
First, I want to see the hostages.
What for?
I need to make sure they're okay.     You said you weren't going to hurt    them... I need to know I can count    on that.
They want to see a hostage, let's    show them a hostage.
Take a good look, lady.  We've got    five more just like her.  And if we    don't get what we want, they're going    to get hurt.
Everyone stands motionless, unsure what to do.  Sisko  moves toward the counter, behind which B.C. is holding  Lee.  Sisko is carrying a shotgun, but doesn't aim  it at B.C...
I think you've made your point.
Have I, Detective?
I'd say so...
Good...
Now if you don't mind, I'd like to    speak to Mister Webb again...
Why would I mind... ?
All right, Detective, I'm here.
Your friend has quite a temper...
That's because he's angry... we all    are.
B.C., let me ask you something...
Go ahead.
Why do I get the feeling you're not    going to be happy until you've hurt    one of those hostages?
I've got to admit, the thought is    tempting... it might alleviate    some of the stress I'm feeling...
I think you'd better find another    way to deal with your stress... it's    sure to be a lot healthier for you    in the long run...
No kidding...       Let me ask you something...       You think it looks better like this...       -- or like this?
It's your head... and your    decision...
Hey, Gabe... Detective Preston wants    to meet with me...
When?
Now... by the main gate.
Mind if I join you?
I was hoping you'd say that.
Keep an eye on the hostages...
Got it.       Good luck.
... it's been a long night.  You two    must be exhausted.
We're okay.  We could use some    breakfast come morning.
Breakfast for ten thousand?  That's    a lot of take-out... but in the    interest of friendship, I'll do what    I can.
No hostage, no food -- is that what    you're saying?
Not at all.  You'll get the food    either way.  But giving up one of    the hostages would show good faith...    besides, you'd still have five left.
Those hostages aren't going anywhere    until we get what we want.
Which is what?
We want the Sanctuaries closed down...    and the Federal Employment Act   reinstated.
That's asking a lot...
I don't think so.  All we want is to    get out from behind these walls...    to stop having to depend on    handouts...
That's right.  All we're asking for    is a chance to get back on our feet    again.  We don't deserve to be locked    up in here.
Obviously I can't promise anything,    but I'll see to it that the Governor    hears your demands.
You do that.
Put me through to the Governor...

scene: 14A  EXT. OUTSIDE SANCTUARY DISTRICT GATE - NIGHT #3

quote: As far as I'm concerned, the only    people who don't belong in there are    those hostages.       Now if you'll excuse me...
scene: 14A  EXT. OUTSIDE SANCTUARY DISTRICT GATE - NIGHT #3

quote: I'm sorry... I wish there was    something else we could do.
scene: 14A  EXT. OUTSIDE SANCTUARY DISTRICT GATE - NIGHT #3

quote: There has to be.
scene: 14A  EXT. OUTSIDE SANCTUARY DISTRICT GATE - NIGHT #3

quote: Brynner...
scene: 14A  EXT. OUTSIDE SANCTUARY DISTRICT GATE - NIGHT #3

quote: I'm fine, don't worry.

quote: Relax, I'm surrounded by a battalion    of National Guardsmen.  Besides,    we're just about to leave.

quote: Jadzia... ?
scene: 14A  EXT. OUTSIDE SANCTUARY DISTRICT GATE - NIGHT #3

quote: Something wrong?
You tell me.  You haven't said a    word since you came back.
I had the chance to save one of the    hostages... Webb was willing to let
You had no choice... according to    history none of the hostages were    freed until the police stormed the    Sanctuary...
I know... but that doesn't make it    any easier...
Are you all right?
Hey, leave her alone.
I'm a doctor.
Sure you are.
You were here the other day, weren't    you?
That's right.
Are you hypoglycemic... ?
You... really are a doctor?
Why didn't you say something?
I was afraid to.
I'll see about getting you some    medicine.  In the meantime I'll try    and find you a chocolate bar or    something.
Wasn't he here with you... ?
Bell?       Yes, we came in together.
He gave me a false name, didn't he... ?
Well... yes.  He got himself into a    little trouble a while back and he    didn't want you to put his real name    in the computer.

When I first started working here, I    processed a woman who had a warrant    out on her for abandoning her kid.     She couldn't take care of him, so    she left him with a family she worked    for over in the Marina.  I felt so    sorry for her I didn't log her in...    I just let her disappear into the    Sanctuary.
That was very kind of you...
Almost got fired when my supervisor    found out.
What happened to the woman?
I don't know... but I think about    her all the time.       Ever since then I've just... done my    job, you know?  And tried not to let    it get to me.
It's not your fault things are the    way they are.
Everybody tells themselves that...    and nothing ever changes...
Hold it!
scene: 19   INT. PROCESSING CENTER - DAY #4 - EARLY MORNING

quote: Don't.
scene: 19   INT. PROCESSING CENTER - DAY #4 - EARLY MORNING

quote: Give me one reason why not.

quote: All right...
scene: 19   INT. PROCESSING CENTER - DAY #4 - EARLY MORNING

quote: You going to shoot me, Bell?  I    don't think so.

quote: Think again.

quote: I thought we were on the same    side, here.

scene: 21   INT. PROCESSING CENTER - DAY #4 - EARLY MORNING -

quote: You heard the man.

quote: Hey...

quote: Listen closely because I'm not going    to say this again.  The next time    you try something stupid I will make    you regret it.
You trying to scare me?
I'm trying to save your life, and    the lives of every hostage in that    room.  And mister, you're not making    it easy.
If you're so concerned about our    welfare why don't you let us go?
You really don't know what any of    this is about, do you?  You work    here, you see these people every day --    how they live -- and you just don't    get it.
What do you want me to say... that I    feel for them... that they got a bad    break?       What good would it do?
It'd be a start...
Now get back out there and keep your
Kira to Sisko.       Kira to Dax.  Kira to Bashir.
I'm not picking up any residual    electrostatic charge.
What?
I said I'm not picking up any residual    electrostatic charge.
What?
They're not here.
Thank you...
Uh-oh...
Wow...
Danny...
He was outside looking for you.
Your mother and Jeannie... are they    okay?
They're fine; they're with the    Petersons.
So what are you doing here?
I wanted to be with you.
All right, you can stay for a while...    but when I tell you to go, I don't    want any arguments.
I found this glucajen in what was    left of the clinic.  You should be    feeling better soon.
Thank you...
Is that your family?
Yeah...
Let him see.
Nice looking bunch, huh?
Absolutely.
Right now those two kids are sitting    home wondering if they'll ever see    their dad again.
I realize this won't make what you're    going through any easier... but    something good will come from all    this.
You think they're just going to close    down the Sanctuary and let you walk    out of here?
No... but I know that someday there    won't be any need for places like    this.
I hope you're right.       Even though it'll mean I'll be out    of a job.
I just want to get home, you know?
I know... so do I.
The Governor has assured me that if    you let the hostages go, the charges    against you will be reduced to    incitement to riot.

quote: That's it?  What about closing the    Sanctuary, what about jobs?

quote: Try opening that menu.
It just brings me back to the same    screen.  There doesn't seem to be    any way to get past the lockout and    log onto the Net.
There has to be.
How can you be certain?
Because according to history, the    residents were able to get onto the    Net and tell their side of the story.     Millions of people watched.
No one here's been able to get past    the lockout.
Maybe it was Bell... and if he did    it, we have to also.
Listen up, everybody.  A couple of    dims just brought us a little    present.
I don't know about you fellas...    but I'm in love.
Jadzia...
Julian...
You know her?
Story of my life... all the good    ones are taken...
You remember my friend Gabe... ?
Gabe Bell... it's good to see you    again.
It's good to see you...
Allow me to introduce myself...
Biddle Coleridge...
Biddle?
Hey.
I didn't say a word.
I've been looking all over for you.
You obviously don't live here... so    how did you get inside?
I managed to recode my I.D.  card    so I could get past the Sanitation    Department checkpoint.
You crawled in through the sewers?        She must really like these guys.
She must really like these guys.
You should sit down.  You look    exhausted.
Too bad...    (off Webb's questioning     look)   I really think me and her could've    had something special...
-- so what you're saying is that    even if I could get you out of the    Sanctuary, you wouldn't leave.
Those hostages have to be protected,    whatever the cost.
You said that one of the men who    brought you here took your combadge...
That's right.  And it's set to emit    a subspace distress signal.
Julian, I want you to help Dax find    the men who took her combadge... and    then I want you both to get away    from this place.
But if the Defiant locks on to my    distress signal... and we're not    together...
As soon as the hostages are in police    custody, I'll try to get back to the    beam-in site.
If for some reason I can't make it,    you'll have to leave without me.

Sir, obviously Jadzia has to leave...    if something happened to her, it    wouldn't take a doctor long to figure    out she wasn't human.       But you're still going to need help    keeping the hostages alive, so if    it's all the same to you... I'll    stay.
All right...       See if you can get her combadge    back...    (glances at wall     monitor)   I'll keep trying to log onto the    Net.
The police cut off our access.
That's one problem I might be able    to help you with.
Do you really think you can convince    your friend to put us on the Net?
It'll take some persuading... but I    think he'll do what's right...
This is it.  The men who took my    combadge brought me here before they    took me to the Processing Center.
Hello?
There's nobody here.
We just want to talk.
Woosh!       I'm invisible.
If you say so.
You can see me?
Just barely.
That's okay.  As long as they can't    see me.
Who?
The aliens.  They'll suck your brains    out... right through your ears.
I know... you see, I'm an alien,    too...
I thought so... but you're a good    alien.
I'm here to protect Earth from its    enemies.  But I need that piece of    jewelry you're holding to do it.
I understand... here, take it.       Good luck.
Thank you.  And remember, don't tell    anyone about this.
I won't... don't worry.
This is where I came in...
Julian... take care of yourself.
We'll see you at the beam-in site.

Let me see if I understand what you're    asking me to do.  You want me to    override a government block, violate    my Interface operating license, and    turn my channels over to a bunch of    criminals.
They're not criminals.
I know that, Jadzia, but they're    acting like criminals.  They've got    guns, they've taken hostages...
So why do you think they're doing    it?  Don't you want to know?  Don't    you think the public deserves to    know?
You're asking me to break the law.
I'm asking you to give those people    a voice.

Chris, sooner or later, the government    is going to retake the Sanctuary    District.  When that happens, a lot    of people are going to die.  And    unless the public learns why the    Sanctuary residents did what they    did, all those deaths will be for    nothing.
You know, I'll probably lose my    license for this...       But at least I'll get good ratings.

... my name is Henry Garcia... and    I've been living here two years now...    I came to San Francisco to work in a    brewery... but they laid a bunch of    us off when they got some new    equipment... and so I ended up here.
I've never been in trouble with the    law or anything... I don't want to    hurt anybody... I just want a chance    to work and live like regular    people...

Governor, I understand your concern...    but I think the use of force would    be premature at this time.       I am aware that there have been    disturbances in other Sanctuary    Districts, but we have to think about    the hostages.       I know.  I've heard the rumors, too.     But that's all they are, rumors.  If    you just give me another chance to    talk with Webb and Bell...       Yes, sir.  Of course.  We'll do our    best.
scene: 37   EXT. OUTSIDE THE SANCTUARY DISTRICT GATE - DAY #4

quote: The Governor's made up his mind.  We    move in at oh five hundred.
scene: 37   EXT. OUTSIDE THE SANCTUARY DISTRICT GATE - DAY #4

quote: No luck?
Afraid not.
Well, we know one thing.  They arrived    before the year twenty-forty-eight.
How can you be sure?
Because we were just there.  And    that wasn't the mid-twenty-first    century that I read about in school.     It's been changed.  Earth history    had its rough patches, but never    that rough.
If we limit our search to dates before    twenty-forty-eight, how many    possibilities does that leave us.
According to my calculations, three.     But we've only got enough chroniton    particles for one more try.
Pick one, Chief.  And let's hope you    get lucky.
That's my best guess.
That's good enough for me.
Energize.
Kira to Sisko.
I'm picking up a combadge distress    signal.  It's Dax.
Kira to Dax.
Kira...
Dax, am I glad to hear your voice.
Where are you?
We should be in the exact location    where you beamed in.
I'll meet you there.
Are Sisko and Bashir with you?
No... I'll explain everything when I    see you.
The transporter is set to    automatically retrieve us in about a    minute.  You'd better deactivate    your combadge.
Acknowledged.
We'll reactivate them tomorrow in    time for the next beam out.
Should be an interesting day...
-- best ball club I ever saw?
The ninety-nine Yankees, no doubt    about it.
Get out of here.  The fifteen Kings    could've taken them any day.       Am I right?
I wouldn't know.  I prefer tennis,    actually.
Soccer...
It's up to you, Bell.
I don't think there's any question.     The Kings.  Fifteen was Buck Bokai's    rookie year.
And that's all they had going for    them.
I've been up on the roof... looks    like another National Guard unit    just arrived.  Something's going    on out there.
All right, everyone on your feet.
What are you doing?
(indicating Lee's     cubicle)   They'll be safer in there.       Let's go.
I want you in there with them.  Make    sure they keep their heads down.
I'll see if I can find something to    block the doorway.
Danny, wake up...
Time for you to go.
But I want to stay here with you.
I'll meet up with you later.
Tell your mom that I love her... and    give your sister a kiss for me.       Go on, now...
Hey, kid.
Yeah, I thought so.  It looks good    on you... now get lost.
What the hell.  It's probably    raining in Tasmania, anyway.
I'm going to talk to Preston, find    out what's going on.
My god...
Stop shooting, dammit!  We're okay!
I'm a hostage, you idiot!
Blue leader, this is team one... the    Processing Center is secure...
What's wrong with you people; you    could've gotten us all killed.
There were rumors you were dead.
Do I look dead to you?
Our orders were to pacify the    building...
(looking around at     the bodies; sarcastic)   Well you certainly did a good job.
Leave him alone.
I copy...       There's trouble on second street...
Go pacify second street.  Officer    Calvera and I can handle things in    here.
All right.       Let's move.
How is he?
Lucky... he'll live...
Next time I tell you to stay down...
Gotcha...
What about Webb?
How could we have let this happen...
The question is... how do we stop it    from happening again...
(to Vin, re: Sisko     and Bashir)   So what do we do with them?
I don't know...
You could let us go.
All right.
Vin...
They saved our lives back there.
How will we explain what happened to    them?
Give me your I.D. cards.
We'll switch these with two of the    casualties.  As far as anyone will    know, you both died here.       That okay with you, Bell?
Thanks...
My pleasure.
Come on, let's get you out of here.
Anything else we can do for you?
There is one thing.
Name it.
Tell people the truth about what    happened in here.
I would've done that anyway...
First Officer's Log, Supplemental.     Upon returning to the present with    our missing crewmembers, we were    relieved to discover that the timeline    had been restored.
Come in.
How do you feel?
Better.
I thought you'd want to see this...    I found it in the historical database.
I'm not looking forward to explaining    this to Starfleet Command.
Well... at least it's a good picture.
Commander... after seeing a little    bit of the twenty-first century...    there's one thing I still don't    understand... how could they have    let things get so bad... ?
That's a good question... I wish I    had an answer...
